DOWNLOADED !
Full Screen / Dolby Digital 2.0 (English / no subtitles)
Special Features : Photo Gallery
Audio/Video Quality : sound is fine for a production of its type and for its year (1982), picture has not been remastered, a little bit better than VHS, but from the same tape source. Colours are washed out, lacks of definition. But it's acceptable.

The Scala was a repetory cinema in London, adjacent to Kings Cross Station, that showed fabulous films: double bills, schlock fests, all nighters ... it was wonderful, even the the feel of trains rumbling below while sitting on the bad seating was something to relish. The Scala sadly closed after a court case following a screening of A Clockwork Orange in the early 1990s (billed, if I recall correctly as Adventures of Alex) when the film had been withdrawn from circulation by Stanley Kubrick. Bands played there from time to time, most notably Iggy and the Stooges in 1973. The venue opened again a few years ago, as a night club/disco/place to see bands, but it is not even a shadow of its former self. A moment in cinema history passed when it closed in the early 1990s.
